title: Business & Finance
text:
Executives and directors at Pfizer, Moderna and other firms developing Covid-19 vaccines sold about $496 million of stock last year.

---

Saudi Arabia plans to increase its oil output in the coming months, reversing a recent big production cut.

---

The SEC is weighing whether to require more transparency in short selling and the mechanics of the bearish trades.

---

The Dow rose 0.3% to a record, while the Nasdaq lost 0.6% and the S&P 500 inched 0.03% lower.

---

Nestle is selling most of its North American bottled-water brands to two private-equity firms for $4.3 billion.

---

Two Americans accused of helping Ghosn flee Japan have appealed to the Biden administration to stop their extradition.

---

Facebook said it would restrict publishers and users in Australia from viewing or sharing news articles, ramping up a standoff there.

---

Google will pay for content from News Corp publications under a three-year licensing deal.

---

Two of Boeing's longtime directors are expected to step down from the aerospace giant's board.
